1:
"Job, no one will stop you from calling out for someone to help you,\q2 but I am certain that no angel will come to you!
\q1
2:
Foolish people die because they are resentful;\q2 people whom others easily deceive—these people die because they envy others.
\q1
3:
I have seen foolish people who seemed to be successful,\q2 but suddenly they experienced disaster because I cursed their home.


\q1
4:
Their sons are never safe;\q2 they always lose to their opponents in court,
\q2 because there is no one to defend them.
\q1
5:
Hungry people steal the crops that foolish people harvest;\q2 they even steal the crops that grow among thorns,
\q2 and greedy people take away the wealth of those foolish people.


\q1
6:
But it is not the farmland that makes bad things happen;\q2 troubles do not grow up from the ground like plants.
\q1
7:
People make trouble for themselves from the time that they are born;\q2 this is as certain as the fact that sparks shoot up from a fire.


\q1
8:
If I were suffering like you are, I would ask God for help\q2 and tell him what I am complaining about.
\q1
9:
He does great things, things that we cannot understand;\q2 we cannot even count the marvelous things that he does.
\q1
10:
He sends rain on the ground;\q2 he makes it rain on our fields.


\q1
11:
He defends those who are humble,\q2 and puts those who mourn into places where they are safe.
\q1
12:
He causes crafty people to not be able to do what they plan to do,\q2 with the result that they achieve nothing.
\q1
13:
The people who think they are wise—he makes their own traps catch them;\q2 the result is that they do not succeed.


\q1
14:
It is as though even in the daytime they were living in darkness\q2 and were groping around trying to find the road at noontime like people do at night.
\q1
15:
But God saves helpless people from the wicked who say evil things about them;\q2 he saves poor people from powerful people harming them.
\q1
16:
So poor people confidently expect that good things will happen to them;\q2 but God stops wicked people from saying evil things.


\q1
17:
But those whom God corrects are fortunate;\q2 so do not despise it when God, who can do anything, disciplines you.
\q1
18:
He wounds people, but then he puts bandages on those wounds;\q2 he hurts people, but he also heals them.
\q1
19:
He will rescue you many times from your troubles,\q2 with the result that nothing evil will happen to you.


\q1
20:
When there is little food to eat, he will not allow you to die,\q2 and when there is a war, your enemies will not kill you.
\q1
21:
God will protect you when people say false, evil things about you;\q2 you will not be afraid when many things around you perish.
\q1
22:
You will be able to laugh when that happens and when there is nothing to eat,\q2 and you will not be afraid of wild animals.


\q1
23:
You will not worry about having big rocks in your fields that will make plowing difficult,\q2 and you will not worry that wild animals might attack you.
\q1
24:
You will know that things will go well for you in your home;\q2 when you look at your livestock, you will see that they are all there.
\q1
25:
You will be certain that you will have many descendants,\q2 who will be as numerous as blades of grass.


\q1
26:
You will become very old before you die,\q2 like sheaves of grain continue to grow until it is time to harvest and thresh them.
\q1
27: My friends and I have thought carefully about these things, and we know that they are true,\q2 so pay attention to what I have said!"
